# ctxt

> Simple tool for managing and generating LLM context files from templates. It helps you maintain IDE rules, prompt templates, and meta-programming documents with tag-based substitutions.  

- ğŸ·ï¸ **Tag Substitution**: Simple `<Tag-Name>` format with recursive support  
- ğŸ“ **Multi-Vendor Support**: Generate rules for Cursor, Claude Coder, and more  
- âš™ï¸ **Flexible Configuration**: YAML-based configuration with sensible defaults  
- ğŸ” **Tag Discovery**: Find all tags used in your templates  
- ğŸš€ **CLI Interface**: Easy-to-use command-line tools  

Perfect for managing project-specific LLM rules, documentation templates, and prompt libraries across different AI coding assistants.

## Docs

- [README](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/civvic/ctxt/refs/heads/main/README.md): Quick start guide and overview

## API

- [API List](https://civvic.github.io/ctxt/apilist.txt): A succint list of all functions and methods in ctxt.

## Optional

- [Config](https://civvic.github.io/ctxt/config.html.md): Configuration loading and validation for ctxt
- [Tags](https://civvic.github.io/ctxt/tags.html.md): Tag discovery and substitution for template processing
- [Templates](https://civvic.github.io/ctxt/templates.html.md): Template file discovery and processing
- [CLI](https://civvic.github.io/ctxt/cli.html.md): Command-line interface for ctxt
